src:
Top Skor Liga Champions Pekan Keempat: Haaland Masih Tertajam
07 Nov 2019, 04:38 by Terjemahan, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Persaingan Erling Haaland (Red Bull Salzburg) dan Robert Lewandowski (Bayern) dalam berebut posisi puncak top skor Liga Champions berlangsung ketat. Keduanya sama-sama mencetak gol dalam laga pekan keempat.
Haaland, 19 tahun, terus unjuk ketajaman buat Slazburg, klub asal Austria. Ia mencetak gol dari titik penalti saat timnya menahan Napoli 1-1 dalam pertandingan Grup E, Rabu dinihari WIB.
Ini menjadi gol ketujuhnya dalam empat laga. Ketajaman yang ditunjukkan pemain muda ini membuatnya jadi incaran banyak klub besar, termasuk Real Madrid dan Manchester United.
Robert Lewandowski juga mencetak gol saat Bayern Munchen lolos ke babak 16 besar dengan menekuk Olympiacos 2-1 pada Kamis dinihari WIB. Tambahan itu membuatnya tetap menempel ketat Haaland, dengan koleksi 6 gol.
Pekan ini, Lionel Messi dan Cristiano Ronaldo gagal mencetak gol. Messi harus melihat timnya, Barcleona, ditahan Slavia Praha 0-0. Sedangkan Ronaldo gagal menjebol gawang lawan saat Juventus lolos ke babak 16 besar dengan meraih kemenangan 2-1 di kandang Lokomotiv Moscow. Keduanya sama-sama menyumbang satu gol di Liga Champions musim ini.
Top skor Liga Champions7 gol: Erling Haaland (Red Bull Salzburg).6 gol: Robert Lewandowski (Bayern).5 gol: Raheem Sterling (Man City), Son Heung-min (Tottenham).4 gol: Harry Kane (Tottenham), Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munchen), Memphis Depay (Lyon), Mislav Orsic (Dinamo Zagreb), Mauro Icardi (PSG), Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund).3 gol: Kylian Mbappe (PSG), Dries Mertens (Napoli), Mohamed Salah (Liverpool), Quncy Promes (Ajax), Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool), Rodygo (Real madrid), Lautaro Martinez (Inter Milan).
text:
Week Four Champions League Top Scores: Haaland Still Sharpest
Nov. 7, 2019, 04:38 by translations, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Competition of Erling Haaland (Red Bull Salzburg) and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern) in fighting for the top position in the Champions League top score is tight. Both of them scored in the fourth week of the match.
Haaland, 19, continued to show sharpness for Slazburg, an Austrian club. He scored from the penalty spot when his team held Napoli 1-1 in a Group E match on Wednesday.
This is his seventh goal in four matches. The sharpness shown by this young player made him the target of many big clubs, including Real Madrid and Manchester United.
Robert Lewandowski also scored a goal when Bayern Munich qualified for the last 16 by bending Olympiacos 2-1 on Thursday. That addition keeps him sticking tight to Haaland, with a collection of 6 goals.
This week, Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo failed to score. Messi must see his team, Barcleona, detained Slavia Prague 0-0. While Ronaldo failed to break down the opponent's goal when Juventus qualified for the last 16 with a 2-1 victory at home to Lokomotiv Moscow. Both of them contributed one goal in the Champions League this season.
Champions League top scorer7 goals: Erling Haaland (Red Bull Salzburg) .6 goals: Robert Lewandowski (Bayern) .5 goals: Raheem Sterling (Man City), Son Heung-min (Tottenham) .4 goals: Harry Kane (Tottenham), Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich), Memphis Depay (Lyon), Mislav Orsic (Dinamo Zagreb), Mauro Icardi (PSG), Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund). 3 goals: Kylian Mbappe (PSG), Dries Mertens (Napoli), Mohamed Salah (PSG), Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund). Liverpool), Quncy Promes (Ajax), Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool), Rodygo (Real Madrid), Lautaro Martinez (Inter Milan).
